thread.title: Jesy Nelson cosies up to TOWIE's Chris Clark at the BRITs
thread.title_full: Jesy Nelson cosies up to TOWIE's Chris Clark at the BRITs | Daily Mail Online

author: Julia Pritchard for MailOnline
title: Jesy Nelson cosies up to TOWIE's Chris Clark at the BRITs

persons.name: anohni ellie goulding lianne la havas nao
bon iver bruno mars leonard cohen
craig david kano michael kiwanuka skepta

organizations.name: clean bandit ft. sean paul & anne-marie
clean bandit ft sean paul & anne-marie - rockabye coldplay
manor michael kiwanuka - love & hate skepta konnichiwa

text:
They have both seen their high-profile engagements come to a heartbreaking end in the public eye.
But Little Mix 's unlucky-in-love members Jesy Nelson and Perrie Edwards looked to be on better romantic form than ever on Wednesday, as they both cosied up to new men at the BRIT Awards .
The blonde beauty, 23, was seen planting a smacker on her new footballer beau Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain at the ceremony, while Jesy, 25, happily cuddled up to TOWIE 's Chris Clark - just one week after rumours of a romance between them emerged.
New man? Little Mix's Jesy Nelson looked to be on better romantic form than ever on Wednesday, as she cosied up to rumoured beau Chris Clark at the BRIT Awards
The TOWIE hunk took to his Instagram after the show to share a photo of him and Jesy arm-in-arm at an after-party, beaming widely at the camera.
Fuelling further rumours of a romance between the pair, the reality star sent fans wild by captioning the shot affectionately: 'I don't want this girl to go back America tomorrow!'
It was reported last week that Jesy and the ITVBe star had embarked on a fling - less than two months after her split from fiancé Jake Roche.
Twice as nice! Band mate Perrie Edwards, 23, was then seen planting a smacker on her new footballer beau Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain at the ceremony (far left)
The singer was seen showing off her best dance moves with the 22-year-old in a series of Snapchat videos, posted by Jesy's friend Sam King during a night out over the weekend.
According to BANG Showbiz, their close display on the dancefloor may be a sign that they're on the road to a new romantic relationship.
The pair started following each other on picture sharing app Instagram earlier this month, sparking rumours of a connection between them.
Onwards? It was reported last week that Jesy and the ITVBe star (R) had embarked on a fling - less than two months after her split from fiancé Jake Roche
The supposed relationship proves Jesy to finally be moving on after splitting from Jake, the lead singer of pop band Rixton.
The singer had spoken to radio station Z100 about the 'awful' break-up process soon after the split, admitting: 'When you break up with someone, it's awful. Is it not one of the worst pains? It's horrendous and we all need a sad song that you sit and cry to.
'At the end of the day, though, you need something that makes you feel empowered ... that makes you think, "You know what I don't need you anymore. I'm going to go out with my girls and I'm going to get over you because I don't need you."'
Loved-up: Jesy is not the only one who has moved on from a high-profile romance - with her band mate Perrie bringing her new man Alex as her date to the BRIT Awards ceremony (L)
Meanwhile Jesy is not the only member of Little Mix who has moved on from a high-profile romance - with her band mate Perrie bringing her new man Alex as her date to the BRIT Awards, and even planting a kiss on him after their win.
The blonde and the Arsenal player went public with their romance just ahead of Valentine's Day this year - marking Perrie's first official relationship since breaking up with fiancé Zayn Malik.
The beauty had announced the news by posting a picture in front of the Eiffel Tower during a romantic French holiday and captioned it simply, 'Him'.
Besotted: The blonde and the Arsenal player went public with their romance just ahead of Valentine's Day this year
Independent: Clearly having moved on from the former loves, the two recent singletons went on to give a literal 'shout out' to their exes as they accepted their award for Shout Out To My Ex
The duo are thought to have been dating since last November, but they are reportedly keen to avoid being defined by their romance.
Clearly having moved on from the former loves, the two recent singletons of the group then went on to give a literal 'shout out' to their exes as they accepted their award for chart-topping hit Shout Out To My Ex.
The band had beaten Perrie's ex-fiance Zayn Malik to pick up Best Single at the 37th BRIT Awards , with her bandmates taking the occasion to thank their former flames in their acceptance speech.
Despite paying tribute to their ex partners in their acceptance speech, Zayn wasn't in attendance, choosing to skip the event despite his nomination.
Victorious: The band had beaten Perrie's ex-fiance Zayn Malik to pick up Best Single at the 37th BRIT Awards, taking the occasion to thank their former flames in their acceptance speech
The girls were not fazed, with Jade gushing on stage: 'Thank you so much. We honestly didn't think we were gonna get it, we were just sat there chin-wagging.
'We'd like to thank our label Sony, Syco, Simon (Cowell), our amazing A&R, our management, and us girls, because if it wasn't for our friendship, we wouldn't still be going. And lastly cheers to our exes for helping us to do an amazing song, this one's for you lads.'
Other nominees in the category included Clean Bandit Ft. Sean Paul & Anne-Marie, Tinie Tempah Ft. Zara Larsson, Jonas Blue Ft. Dakota, James Arthur, Alan Walker, Coldplay, Calum Scott and Calvin Harris Ft. Rihanna.
Shout Out! Despite the fact Little Mix payed tribute to their ex partners in their acceptance speech, Perrie's former fiance Zayn Malik wasn't in attendance, choosing to skip the event despite still being nominated for Best Single
Whilst Zayn missed out on an award, his former band One Direction won on the night, picking up Video Of The Year for History.
The only member of the group present on the evening was Louis Tomlinson, who said: 'This is amazing thank you so much I’m sure I speak on behalf of the rest of the boys I can’t believe we are still winning these.
'We have been taking a bit of time out working on our own material but One Direction is who we are and who we always will be.'
Winners! The songstress, 23, was joined by the rest of Little Mix - Jesy Nelson, Leigh-Anne Pinnock and Jade Thirlwall - as they scooped the gong for their number one hit, Shout Out To My Ex
Loving life: The girls were not fazed, with Jade gushing on stage: 'Thank you so much. We honestly didn't think we were gonna get it, we were just sat there chinwagging'
Legs eleven! The girls were overcome with emotion after winning the award as they sashayed back to their seats
Jump to it! Earlier in the evening the girl group performed Shout Out To My Ex in front of the packed stadium
